How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. What type of cards did he choose, instead? Choices:  A: cursive writing B: hand writing C: store bought D: online media E: hand written<n><n>### Response:		Cards bought on the internet<n>### Rationales: B has been eliminated, because James chose to print the cards himself.<n>C has been eliminated, as that does not refer to the content of the cards.<n>D has been eliminated, since it refers to information that may be in the cards.<n>E has been eliminated, for the same reason.<n>Based on remaining options, answer is C.<n><n>### Input : What is 6.03 -0.06?<n><n>### Response : 5.97<n><n>### Rationals: When subtractiing numbers with the same decimal places, the result is rounded. That means that the result is either rounded down or rounded up.<n>When subtracting the whole number with the same number. the result is rounded down. that means that you get the lower number.<n>Example: 2 - 2 = 0.  the result is rounded down to 0.<n><n>### When the fraction that is being subtracted is the same.<n><n>Example: 3/8 - 3/8 = 0. the result is rounded to 0.<n>the result is the same as subtracting the whole number, the fraction with the same decimal places that is being subtracted.<n><n>### The example is same as<n><n>23.5 - 23.5 = 0 the result is 0.<n><n>35.5 - 35.5 = 0  the result is 0<n><n>Answer: In this case, we should add all the decimal places in the number to get the correct result.<n>So  we add (.)6 and (.)3, that means we make the second number into (.)9<n>If you already have a second number of a dot, just add the number you have to the decimal. that will get you into your right answer.<n><n>## Input<n>A restaurant has a basket with a total of $35,000 in change, and it also has a vault that has a total of $3,000 in coins along with $4,800 in bills. How much money does the restaurant have in all total?<n><n>## Rationals<n>In this case, you can use the whole number, then adding the decimal places of the numbers.<n><n>## Answer<n>In this case, all the changes are being counted

You can multiply or divide fractions.<n><n>### Response A<n>### Explanation<n>The number you place over or under any other number is called the DENOMINATOR of the fraction. The bottom of the fraction is called the NOMINATOR.<n><n>You can multiply and divide fractions so long as you are able to find a number you can multiply and divide by the denominators that will get you the result you want. For instance, if you need to divide 2/3 by 5, you can figure it out by using the fact that if the denominator is less than 10, you can divide by 10 and keep the same number of 8’s on the ends of your answer. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:What is the worst outcome of an injury? Choices:  A: cause death B: cause bleeding C: falling down D: become infected E: claim insurance<n><n>### Response:		A. Input: What is the last digit in 67?<n><n>289<n><n>

If you are working on a desktop computer, then you can use any IDE that you like. To work with [HackerRank CodePlayer](https://docs.hackerrank.io/code-player/installing-code-player/install-code-player-on-linux.html), you can follow the installation instructions available [here](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/wsl/install-manual#linux-distribution-versions) to add a new distribution from the Windows Store within Windows.<n>* Clone the repository:<n>```<n>git clone https://github.com/hackerrank/curriculum.git<n>```<n>* Open the local repository within the IDE: ```cd curriculum/python```<n><n>### Answer the question<n><n>In each step, we are going to describe how the answer could be produced.  We will then provide a fully built example to show you what the code _could_ look like.<n><n>### Task 1: [Examples](1.md)<n><n>### Task Details<n><n>**Input:**<n><n>```<n>Ruby<n>```<n><n>**Answer:**<n><n><table class="table table-bordered"><n><tr><n><th>A: 57</th><n><th>B: 2</th><n><td>257</td><n></tr><n><tr><n>    <th>C: 93*2</
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:What appliance uses water and soap? Choices:  A: washing machine B: space shuttle C: blender D: disneyland E: surface of earth<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>###<n><n>### Input/Response<n>###<n><n><n>###Input: <n><n>###Output:<n>

He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:The king was to meet an ambassador, where would the meet? Choices:  A: court B: dinning room C: throne room D: monarchy E: castle<n><n>### Response:		<n>Choice: B<n><n>### Rationales:<n><n>The "court," or more generally a "courtyard," is the area outside the king's "chamber," or bedroom. In the same way that a "throne room" is used to refer to the king's bedroom, "the dinning room" refers to the area outside the king"s chamber as well.<n>The "castle" is the residence of the king, which includes its bedroom, the "throne room."<n>The "monarchy" is the office of the king, or "royalty." In the same was as a "castle" refers to all elements of the king's household, the word "monarchy" should also refer to the same.<n><n>### Choice: C<n><n>Same as answer choice B, except that the "throne" is also in the "throne," or king's, "chamber."<n><n>### Choices: D & E<n><n>The word "monarchy" refers to the king's office, or "kingship." The "castle," or bedroom of the king, is not part of the kingship.<n>Choice D is incorrect because the king resides in a castle.<n>Choice E is incorrect since "castle" is the name for that element of the king's dwelling.<n><n>### Rationale:<n><n>**Definition of Word "Din":**[Din](https://en.oxforddictionaries.com/definition/din)<n> 1. an unpleasant and prolonged noise, typically that of a group of people talking loudly.<n> <n>"He couldn't get any sleep with the din from the restaurant downstairs"<n>synonyms [din · noise · commotion · ruckus · clamor · din · uproar · racket · clatter · hubbub · noise · tumult · row | cacophony]<n><n>### Response<n><n>The following is the original request:<n><n>Write a response that appropriately complete the request.<n><n>The following is Tutor's Instruction and Demonstration: <n><n>Instruction:Your instructions were: Explain why the statement is true or false, or why it is undecided.<n><n>Demonstration: <n>The correct answer is "False

Choices:  A: pleasure B: accident C: get somewhere D: hurt E: falling down<n><n>### Response:		<n>The correct answer is: C (A)<n>The sentence is ambiguous (has a vague meaning and uses imprecise language) because it is open to more than one interpretation. To make the sentence clearer, we can use synonyms more appropriate to the given situation.<n>For example, instead of saying "riding bike through rough terrain", we might say "using a bicycle on bumpy roads".<n><n>The reason that riding a bicycle can be dangerous is because one might get hurt, or even more seriously, be involved in an accident or even crash. The correct response is C; however, we can also say C1 (B), since bumps on the road are the source of bicycle accidents and injuries. The difference between choices A (Pleasure) and B (Accident) is ambiguous. According to Dictionary.com, pleasure is a noun that refers to a source of enjoyment or happiness, or the feeling aroused by such thoughts or objects. An accident is an undesirable occurrence unintended and unexpected happenstance; a misfortune. (https://www.dictionary.com/browse/pleasure (Web)) (https://www.lexico.com/definition/accident)<n><n>#### 1.<n>Question (A):What is 28x34 in decimal?<n><n>Question (B):What is 34x46 as a mixed number?<n><n>#### 3.<n>Question (C):Which of the following can be the result of a negative multiplication? Choices: 1: -6<n>2: -9<n>3: -12<n>4: -15<n><n>### Rationales:<n>First, we'll define the term negative integer by making it explicit in the question. Negative integers are any number that is less than zero (negative number). To find the answer, we need to first cancel out the negative sign from the numbers, and then add the exponents to get the result: <n><n>$$<n>\fbox{$\begin{array}{l}<n>A) -6x-9 = -15 \\B) -6x-8 = -14<n>\end{array}$}<n>$$<n>We know that all integers are positive and negative, so it's correct to call all non-zero integers, real numbers because they are numbers that exists in the natural number

On the way there, both of them stop at 3 stores. When they finally get to a fourth store, they both buy the same thing." Which statement is true?<n>Choices:  *They walk the entire distance to the fourth store.<n>*They each buy 3 different things in each store they stop at.<n>*Neither Karina nor Sage bought the same thing.<n>*They walk to the fourth store<n><n>### Option A:<n>The correct answer is A.They each buy 3 things.<n><n>When Karina and Sage stop at 3 stores during the journey, they each buy 3 things:<n><n>| Store | Karina's item | Sage's items|<n>|-------|----------| ---- |<n>| 1 Store| The first thing Karina bought is the fourth thing Sage bought | Third thing Sage bought|<n>|  | Second thing Karina bought is a sixth thing sage bought| | Fourth thing Karina bought |<n>| | | First thing Sage bought is eight things Karina bought|| Fifth thing Sage bought| <n><n>This means that the Karina or Sage's buys 6 items in the first store, 5 items in the second store, and 4 items in the third store.<n><n>In the 4h store, they each buy an item (making 9 total)<n><n>When they finally reach the fourth store, they each buy one thing, since they are both out of items.<n><n>| Store | 1 store | Karina's items | Sage's buy |<n>|-------|---------- |----- |---- |<n>|  |

He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:How can you get in shape if there is no land nearby? Choices:  A: swim B: jog C: excercise D: work out E: rock climb<n><n>### Response:		<n>I believe you can work from home!<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:What are ai machines known for doing? Choices:  A: fly B: milk cows C: eat D: answering questions E: fail to work<n><n>### Response:		Incorrect

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. She gave 23 pennies to her brother, whom had 6 pennies. It will take 2 hours to swim 50 miles. What fraction of the person's total time is spent swimming the other 70 miles?<n>To swim a certain number of miles, multiply the number of miles by 10 = a * 10 <n>Then divide 11 by 11 = b/11<n>Then the person's time spent on the other 70 is (a-b)/11<n>120/10 = 12/10 m *

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:He wore the wrong shoes while walking all day, now he has what on his heels and toes? Choices:  A: exercise B: moving forward C: feet D: blisters E: locomotion<n><n>### Response:		<n>### Instruction :Answer the question given Below. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:When he was a small child he called the giraffe mascot a cow, it was a fond memory of the now defunct what? However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:Why might a person go to get counseling? Choices:  A: to be heard B: receive gifts C: understand themselves D: good things in life E: acknowledgment<n><n>### Response:		<n><n><n>Counselling helps an individual to find solutions to their issues and problems. It is a service rendered by trained and licensed professionals who provides support, guidance, and coping strategies to those who are experiencing psychological or emotional distress. Counsellors help to identify the root of the problem and work with the client to develop coping strategies and action plans to address and overcome the challenges facing them.<n><n>The answer is C: _______________________________________________________________________________________<n><n><n><n>### Rationales<n><n>A person might consider engaging in counseling and getting services from a counselor to solve specific problems, including:<n>* Coping with trauma: Counseling may help individuals overcome the effects of trauma, such as physical and emotional injuries, or the death of a loved one, and to develop coping mechanisms and strategies for managing their symptoms.<n>* Overcoming addiction: Counselors can help people identify the underlying causes of their addictions and develop strategies to overcome them and achieve long-term recovery.<n>* Addressing mental health issues: Counselors can provide support and guidance to individuals with mental health issues such as anxiety, depression, bipolar disorder, and more.<n>* Overcoming personal issues: Counseling and therapy can help to identify and overcome personal issues, such as negative thoughts, feelings, and behaviors. The therapist can work with the individual to break negative mental patterns and develop healthy coping strategies.<n>* Coping with stress: Counseling can help individuals to cope with stress and manage their feelings in a more productive and effective way, leading to better stress management and a healthier lifestyle.<n><n><n>### Note:<n>Your submission must be at least (5) characters. (Not including your name and email address).<n> <n><n>### Note<n>Your submission must be between {{200-600}} characters ( not including your name and email).<n><n>### Input<n>Jonas and Emi are having an argument about a movie. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:What might someone do who is having fun? Choices:  A: being happy B: glee C: smoke D: stress relief E: may laugh<n><n>### Response:		In this example, the student's incorrect response of  D: Stress Relief is marked wrong because it is not in a reasonable range of plausible choices.<n><n>A good response would be A: being happy.<n><n>Another example where this is true of  C: Smoke, is:<n><n>Smoke might be a fun activity for some people, but smoking can also cause serious health problems, so we cannot simply assume smoke is fun for the person in this situation.  The correct choice would be A: being.<n><n>If there were a question along the lines of, "What might someone do who finds reading boring or difficult?" then a student was very likely to choose A: smoking because the student mistakenly associated smoking with the concept of fun.<n><n>### Input:"The value 1044 is more than 1000" Check All That Apply<n>Rationales:<n>Choice: **The answer must be 1000 or more**<n>All of the other answers are less than 100<n><n>**The answer must be more than 1044**<n>Choice: **The value that is more than 1,000 is 1044.**<n>Choice: **More than 100 is 110.<n>The value that is at least 100 is ___.**<n>Choice: **100 is less than 11_10__.**<n>Choice: **No other answer is more than 11_0_.**<br /><n>**Explanation:** I have shown evidence that the choices are all wrong. (These farmhouses are known as the "old way".) In Western Kansas, they are made of corrugated metal. They are built with the high side to the main road, and the low side on the other side of a long, flat driveway, which is parallel to the road. In Virginia, they are built in the same way as Western Kansas, but the barns are built on concrete foundations with cinder block walls. A building which looks like a barn can hold tractors, cattle and hay bales of hay, but is never used for dairy cattle and milk. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:A gentleman is very wealthy and flaunts it, where does he likely live? The poet uses the description of the dog to show us the kind of dog it is. The speaker and Blacky are like one person and their story makes sense
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:What chore might a child have to do after breakfast, before getting on the bus? Choices:  A: drop out of school B: ask questions C: enter school D: wash dishes E: read book<n><n>### Response:		<n>A<n><n>### Instructions:For each choice in the question, write the appropriate letter in the blank.<n><n>### Options:<n>A: drop out of school<n>B: ask questions<n>C: enter school<n>D: wash dishes<n>E: read book<n><n>#### A<n>Answer: drop out of school

Choices:  A: from the sky B: map C: cross counties by car D: country E: michigan<n><n>### Response:		Choice D<n><n>### Input::A man wants to buy a bottle of cactus juice from a convenience store. There are 3 convenience stores close to his house. He first tries the convenience store in downtown Detroit. Unfortunately, the store does not carry the cactus juice. He then visits a convenience store that is just outside the city. However, the store also does not have any cactus juice for sale. Finally, he visits a convenience store on the outskirts of town. The store in the small suburb, however, is out of cactus juices as well. The man realizes that he will have to travel farther to buy some cactus juice, so he heads to the airport to visit an international duty free store, where he finally purchases a bottle of the cactus juices. The man is glad that the last convenience store had the cactus juichees.<n><n>### Question: How far is the convenience store at the airport from the house?<n><n>### Instructions::Use numbers and digits correctly.<n><n>### Rationales::<n>The man starts driving at 6:30, and his round trip drive lasts exactly 45 minutes, as indicated by the times on his dashboard. Since the man made five stops on his way, he drove approximately 120 miles, or.25 miles per minute.<n><n>The man's house is located 36 blocks away from downtown Detroit, but only 5 blocks away from the suburb. The man then drove to the airport, which is exactly 136 blocks away from his home. Since the man traveled.25 miles per minte, he covered.25 *. 36 = <<(0.25)(36)=8.6 miles during the first half-hour of his trip. The man can cover the next 100 miles of his trip (8.6 + 100) miles during the second half of his trip.<n><n>#### 8.6<n>Answer: 8.6<n><n>### Input :What is the next digit in the sequence? E, B, A, D,?, C,?, J,?<n><n>### Response A, C<n><n>### Instruct:Use numbers and digits correctly<n><n>### A

Choices:  A: raise corn B: seed plants C: grow plants D: seed crops E: farm land<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>The correct option is a)raise corn<n><n>### Explanatory answer:<n><n>I checked every option and they all had words I used at some point. But there are two things that don’t make sense to me:<n>Corn was used as feed for the birds, so we will need it again the next year.<n>We have to use the rest of the corn we used from last year. This means the rest can’t be new, so it’s not an option.<n><n>As for option D, it can be anything that grows, but the word is grow, so it would grow new seeds this year if it was a plant that’s why is option E is incorrect. It’s not a crop we have to grow again.<n><n>For all this reason, the correct option is a) raise corn.<n><n>### Input A: I need to find the price in dollars of the car shown below. How much does the car cost? Choices: A. B. C. D. E. F.<n><n>### Response A:<n><n>The correct answer is D) for $120<n><n>### Reasoning A:<n>So I wrote down the equations.<n><n>```<n>5 + 3 + 6 + 3 = 17 <n>17 + 9 = 26<n>26 + 3 + 3 = 32<n>32 - 6 = 26<n>```<n><n>As you can see we have our answer of $32.<n><n>### Reaction B:<n>I tried everything including a pattern but in the end I decided to just use trial and error. Because if we get 26 for the car it would just make sense since we are trying to get to 32 which is 32-6=26<n><n>We get 32 by getting 9 for the 4 tires, then 6 for the engine, then 3 for the radio and finally 3 for the tires.<n><n>### Experimental answer B:<n><n>Let's take the number of tires first.<n>The car has 8 tires and 2 are for the rim:<n><n>8 - 2 = 6<n><n>Next<n><n>9+6+6+3 = 26<n><n>Next<n> <n>6+3 = 9<n><n>The next one has to

Choices:  A: grocery store B: grocery bag C: restaurants D: farmer's market E: bushel basket<n><n>### Response:		Choice D (Farmer's Market) is correct.<n><n>### Explain:  Farmer's Markets are located in a few areas like Union Square, they only sell things that were made by people on their property. You will never find the same thing twice if you go to one of the many Farmer's Marked in your area.  The food is always clean and farm fresh.  It's not always in your budget but it is definitely cheaper.  The most important thing is that it is local.<n><n>### Input :  What is 300 + 2000 - (35+100)!<n>#### Rationales:<n>1. the brackets mean to do something inside the brackets. so 100!, means you have to multiply 100 to each number between 1-100 to get your total<n>2. if you have to subtract from the total, you write (-x)<n>3. now you have to multiply everything you have written so far.<n>4. now the second and third step will cancel each other out.<n>5. you have to add 2 numbers together to get the answer. it will be 300 + (2000 + (35 + 100)) - 100! = 300 +405 - 100 = -38 + 305 - 1<n><n>### Input 300 +2000- (35 +100) = -38 +305 - 3<n><n>### Answer<n>#### 3<n><n>## 6th Grade Math<n><n>### Answer

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:Where would I put a rosebush if I did not have any containers to store it in? Choices:  A: flower garden B: garden center C: pot D: pot E: formal garden<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Input(cont'd):What two pieces of math equipment would be most necessary for a class learning about fractions? Choices:  E: ruler and protractor F: compasses G: calculator H: balance I: protractor and ruler<n><n>### Response(cont'd):I<n><n>### Input:(3rd Question):If you have four quarts of liquid you do not need, you can sell it for $2 a quart. What would you get if you sold all four quarts, but each time you subtract 25% off the selling price? Choices:(1st Option) E: 3 quarts $5<n>(2nd Option) F: 2 quarts $0<n>(3rd Option) G: 1 quad $4<n>(4th Option) H: 1 quart $4<n>(5th Option) I: 0 quarts $0<n><n>### Response:(3rd Question,cont':):4<n><n>* 4 / (1-(0.25*4)) = 4 / (1-0.25) = 4 / 0.75<n>* Multiply both sides by the reciprocal of 0.75 (1/0.75 = 0.13), you get 4 /(1)(0.75)(0.13) = 4(0.13)<n>* 4*(0.13) is 0.52, so you got 1 quart for $4.<n>

Choices:  A: glass of water B: build evenly C: garage D: carpenter's shop E: video game<n><n>### Response:		D: "Bob would go to the carpenter'sshop"<n>### Rationale:In the carpents shop, one can be provided with all the tools in needed to create a shelf for Bob.<n><n>### ## Input: Tapanga and Katie were in the living room on a Thursday. How many days were between Tapanga and Katies Thursday?<n>Rationales. Let t = the number of Thursday between Tapanga's and Katie's Thursday.<n><n>Thus, >>2*2=4>>22 and 4 = t < 0<n><n>t - 3 = the number of Thrusdays between their Thursday (their first Thursday together)<n><n>Tapanga and Katie - 2 = the number of Thusrday between their first Thrusday together and Friday<n><n>If Katie's first Thursday was 2 weeks ago, then Tapanga's first Thursway was 2+2 = 4 weeks ago<n><n>Subtracting one week to get the number of Thursdays since,<n><n>20 - 2 = 18<n><n>Therefore, >>t=18>>t=18t - 3 = 15The answe is 15 as per the above calculation<n><n>### Response D<n>### ## Input : How many cents is a dime worth (ignoring inflation)? Input: a. 10 b. 12 c.15 d. 17<n>Rationales:<n>- >>>>a:10<<<< 10 / 10 = <<10/10=1>>1<n>- b = 10 * 12/10 = <<12/10>>2<n>- c = 10 * (15/10) = 150/10 = 15<n>- d = 100/10<n><n>#### b<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### ##Input: 3 people leave a restaurant and their bill is $12.05. 5 more people leave and their bill is $92.19. The restaurant takes credit cards by calling a local credit card processing center and processing the information. 40% of the time, there is only
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:Where in a town would you put your shed? Choices:  A: next to the house B: keeping things in C: backyard D: farm yard E: ranch<n><n>### Response:		<n>If you would put your shed in the backyard, press A.<n><n>### If you would put your shed at the ranch, press B.<n><n>### Else if you would put your shed next to the house, press C.<n>  <n>### Else if, you would put your shed where ever you want, press D.<n><n>### Answer:<n>A  <n><n>### Input, If the temperature outside is 20 degrees, and the inside of the house is 70 degrees, which would you prefer? Choices: A: the outside B: the inside C: It doesn't matter<n><n>### Response, If you would prefer A, press the lower temperature. If you would prefer B, press the higher temperature. Else, press neither.<n><n>### Input If you would prefer A or B, press A.<n>If you would prefer B or neither, press B.<n> <n>### If you prefer neither, press C.<n><n>###Else, enter 0<n><n>### Else, enter 1 for no preference<n><n>### Answer, If you prefer A, press 20. If you prefer B, press 70.<n>Else if you prefer neither, press 0.<n>If you prefer B, press.<n>If you prefer A, press.<n><n>### You can also get 0 if you have no preference

He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:What do humans take in while breathing? Choices:  A: lungs and diaphram B: oxygen C: abdominal muscles D: air E: open throat<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Input<n>```<n>Let b equals the bill number<n>b + 2 = the price of that item<n>1. b - 2 = the price before 10% tax is added<n>2. (b - 2) / 1 (r) = the final price<n>3. (b + 2) + (b - 2)/ (100 r /100) = the new price<n>```<n><n>### Response<n><n>Let b equals the number of the item.<n>b + 2 equals the price of that item.<n>1. Bill - 2 = the total of the items before the 10% tax was added.<n>2. (b-2) / 100 <n>3. (b+2) + (b-2)//(0.1 *1 <n>4. 100 * 1/(1.1) = the final price.<n><n><n><n>### Input(2 of them)<n>```<n>x/y = a number<n>y/ x = (a number/ x)<n>a number ^2 = a number x' a number<n>a ^ b = a * a' b * b<n>y' = y +1<n>```<n><n>## Response (2 of them)<n><n>Let x = the variable that we want to find<n>x/y = 4<n>y/ x = 1/4<n>4^2 = 1 x 1<n>4^2 =8 <n>x^2= 8<n>4^2 =>>2^2=4 x 4 = 8^2<n>y' = y_2<n>5^2 = 25<n><n><n>```<n>(0.1/1) ^ 5 = 0.1 ^ (3 * 2) = 0.0002 ^ 6 <n>x^5 = 0.01<n>```<n><n>```<n>3^3 = 27<n>3^7 = 27^2 = 829 <n>3^7 =>> (3^0)*3^(6)=(27/1)=27<n>5^2 = (5/1)*(10/1) = 100<n>```<n><n>## 3 of them<n>```<n>(5/1) ^7 =5 <n>(5/1)^
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:Where is a lion likely to live? Choices:  A: veldt B: ocean C: savannah D: africa E: jungle<n><n>### Response:		The lion lives in a lion's den, so he would live a veldt, a savannah, or an africa.<n><n>### Input:[I am having the best time of my life. I'm not sure what to buy at the mall, though. I think I will buy a new phone. What do you think I should spend my money on?](:)<n><n>### Response:[I think you should spend your money on a new phone. You have a great time when you use your phone, so it would be worth a new one.]<n><n>### Input:{Choose all that apply.} [You are a turtle. You live on my shoulder. I am a human. I don't think you should ever eat me. I don't see how you even get food to eat.]<n><n>### Response:{:}<n><n>### Input:(Let x be the number of apples in a person's bowl. Then 5x = 8 is the equation of a vertical line that passes through the point (2, 4). How many apples are in the person's bowl if she has 8?<n>Rationales:(The vertical line passing through the point (2, 4))<n><n>### Input:`In a classroom, there are 40 girls and 36 boys. How many boys are there in the classroom?<n>Rationales:`Let x be the number or boys in the classroom`<n>40 (x) = 36'<n>5x = 2x<n>x = <<29=30>>30<n>29 - 30 = 1 boy<n><n>### Input:@"I want a pair of leggings!"<n><n>### Response:@"Okay"<n><n>### Input:"My brother made a joke. I don't know why!"<n><n>### Rationales:['I don't know why!' is a response to a joke, and this indicates you did not understand the joke.]<n><n>### Answer:["Okay." is an appropriate response here. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. Where would he go to get to the third floor of his apartment building? Choices:  A: space shuttle B: detroit C: stairs D: downtown E: elevator<n><n>### Response:		C: stairs<n><n>### Rationales:Since John is in a wheelchairs due to an accident, he would not be able to use a detroit or elevator to get to the 3rd floor of his apartment. Since he is in a wheelchai he would have to take the stairs.<n><n>### Input is below<n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>### Rationale<n><n>I would use option E. since the only option that had an explicit description of what it was, to me seemed like that is what i would use.<n><n>### Example:<n>Lisa and her younger brother Jack are trying to reach the roof of their house for some reason. The stairs are very steep, have no handrail, and there is nothing beneath them but grass. Lisa decides to use the door at the top of the stairs - but before she can open it, she remembers something she hasn't thought of in years - her parents installed a locked door upstairs for privacy. If she is unable to get through the door because it's locked, what would she do? Choices: A: walk downstairs and use the door downstairs B: use the door upstairs<n><n>### Response<n><n>B: use the door up stairs<n><n>## Instructions:<n><n>### Input<n>A student can select one of the following options to get to the third-floor classroom:<n><n>Option A. Go to the front parking lot, walk to the corner store, then cross the intersection at a pedestrian light. Then walk down the sidewalk to the front entrance and through the main doors to the classroom.<n><n>Option B. Walk to the second-floor classroom and take the stairs. Then walk to the front entrance, go through the main doors and all the way downstairs to the classroom. The front corridor upstairs is too long and narrow for a wheelchair.<n><n>Option C. Park in the lot by the main library entrance, then walk through the main entrance. Follow the corridors to the main entrance to the front of the building, go up the stairs, and then through the main doors of the classroom.<n>Option D. If your hands are injured, you would be unable to use the stairs.<n>Option E. The front entrance is closed, and you must
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:One might find theirs open, with the letters that had been delivered stolen. Choices:  A: front door B: newspaper C: post office D: package E: mail box<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Demnstration:<n>Letters that are stolen are not delivered to your door. The thief can pick your letter up at the post office.<n><n>__Response:__<n><n>#### C<n>Answer: C<n>

Bruce has 11 more books than Anna. If Anna has 17 books, what is the total number of books that they share?<n><n>### Rationale:Let T represent the total number of books shared by Bruce and Anna.<n>Thus: Bruce's books = T - 11<n>Anna's books = T<n>Subtracting Anna's books from Bruce's books, we get:<n>11 (book shared by Anna) + T = T - 1 + T = T -10<n>Multiply both sides by 11:<n>11 * (book shared by Anna + T) = T * 11<n>Multiply both side by 11 and subtract 11 from both sides:<n>111-11(book shared by Anna) - 11(book shared )T = 111 * 11 - 11 * 1<n>Rewrite this last equation as:<n>1171 - 121 = T<n>Divide both sides by 17:<n>Rewrite each equation as:<n>{(\(\frac{11}{17}*\((book shared by Anna)\))} + {(\(\frac{T+1}{17}\) * \(\frac{1}{17} \))}} = {(\(\frac{1}{14}\) * \((book shared by Anna))}<n>Rewrite:<n>{(11/14 * `(book shared by Anna))` )} + {(T + 1/17)} = {(1/14  * `(book shared by * Anna))<n>Add `(book shared by Anna)` to both sides:<n><n>Let x represent the sum of `(book shared by Anna)`.<n><n>{([11}/14] * (x))} + {(T+1)/17) = (1/14)[(x) ]<n><n>Add 14 to both sides:<n>{[11}/14]((x)+14)

He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:After attending school for twelve years what do you do? Choices:  A: inspiration B: much work C: boredom D: graduate E: degree<n><n>### Response:		If the response is C then the solution is given by the formula ((A-D)/2)+D<n><n>### Examples:<n>Input: The solution is C; and the answer is D<n>#### D<n>Answer: D<n><n>Input: The solution after finding the mean is A; and A is evenly divided into 3,4,5 by the number 2 and hence becomes B<n>#### B<n>Answer: B<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:To what part of your home is your morning paper delivered? However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. Choices:  A: book B: meeting C: television D: guide E: newspaper<n><n>### Response:		<n>The choices are:<n>A: book<n>B: meeting<n>C: television<n>D: guide<n>E: newspaper<n>#### A<n>We have the following equation for how much time people spend getting information:<n>TimeGettingInformation  = 20 + (2 * TimeGettingInformation)<n>Since TimeGettingInformation = the hours, we have:<n>20 + (2 x 20) = 20 hours for each type of information.<n>Solving for time, we get 180.180 hours for each type.<n>#### 2<n>Answer: 3.6 hours, or about half a day each year.<n><n>### Input Where does the most important information come from?<n>Choices: A: friends B: teacher<n>C: student D: parent<n><n>### Response<n>The choices are: A: friends <br> B: teacher <br> C: student <br> D: parent.<n><n>#### B<n>We have the following for how important the above sources are:<n>Information  + TimeSpendingTimeOnTheInformation  = Importance<n>Since we are looking for the most important information, we set this equal to 100<n>Multiplying both sides by TimeGettingInformation we get:<n>Information + 2 * TimeGettingInfo rmatioRatio  =100<n>We have:<n>Information  = TimeGettingInformation  - 2 * TimeGetingInformation <n>We multiply both sides by TimeGetInfo Ratio/ 2 to get:<n>TimeGettingInfo Ramrio/2 + TimeGettingInfofRatio  = 50<n><n>We are looking for how Important Information is and so we subtract<n><n>TimeGettingInfo /Ratio/2 from each side to get:<n>-TimeGettingInfo/RRatio/2 - Information Rate / 2 = 25<n>Since timeGettingInformation  Ratiol is 180, we have:<n>-180 - 180 = 0<n>So Important Information  is as importan As all other information.<n>#### A<n>Answer: Friends.<n><n>### Response::<n>1) Tapanga and Coree each get 17 candies. Tapanga also has exactly twice as many quarters as Corey. How many quarters do they have in total?<n>RationalesWrite the equation for total dollars. Then, solve for x, the total number of quarters.<n><n>\$ 51 + x + 2x = 128\$<n>\$ 52 + x = 128 \to 128 = 52 + x\$<n>\$ x = 76\$<n><n>#### 76<n>Answer: 76<n><n>```<n>Output: If the price of a pound of cherry juice decreases by $1 and the price of 2 pounds of orange juice increases by $3, will the average price per gallon of juice increase or decrease?<n>Choice A: Increase<n>Choice B: Decrease<n>Choice C: Stay the same<n>Choice D: Increase<n>choice E: Decrease<n>```<n>```<n>Output:In which part of New York City did the 2015 New Year’s Eve countdown occur?<n>Choice A: Times Square<n>Choices B: Central Park<n>Choices C: Rockefeller Center<n>D Choices E: Radio City Music Hall<n>D Choices E Choices F: 5 Points<n>```<n>```<n><n>### Instction:In his essay, “Ducks on the Subway”, Jamaal describes the people around him who behave like ducks. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:George ruined the surprise. The same plane flies 700 kilometers during seven hours and ten minutes. How many kilometers does this plane fly every hour?<n><n>### Rationales<n>To answer this question, you can first subtract 300 from 700 to get 400. Then, you can figure out the units of the number of kilometers.<n>Answers: 400 kilometers per hour.<n><n><n>### Input <n>Eight people eat a total of 50 pizza slices in one hour. How many people share two slices each?<n><n>### Response<n><n>### Rationale<n>Multiply 50 slices by 8 people. 1/1. Then, divide 50 by 8: 6.25.<n>In other words, 6.25 people need to share a pizza slice. <n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:Where do fish spend the majority of their time? Choices:  A: body of water B: lake superior C: underwater D: toilet E: aquarium<n><n>### Response:		(answer B)<n><n>### Input::Write a statement to describe the function. A function is written as: f (x) = f(x), where f = <<f=f>> and x = <<x=x>>.<n><n>### Response Example:<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: Gina’s favorite number is 4.<n>Example: Gina’s function is going to be f(x) = x.<n>Gina says x = <<x=4>>, f = <<f=Gina's favorite number>>, so this is going to be f of 4.<n>Input: Bubblegum Costs $1.45 a pack, and the pack contains two 5 cent pieces, 3 dimes, two 20 cent pieces, and seventeen 25 cent pieces. How much money have the pieces in total?<n>Demonstration: Gina’s Function is going to be f (x).<n>f of 4, and then we are going to take f of 9, and we are going to be taking f of 35.<n>And this shows we are working on the first example that Bubble gum costs $1.45 (15 cents), which it actually costs 75 cents. So it looks like you are going to have 20 of the pieces, and you are going to have twenty 25 cent pieces, 15 of those, and then you are going to have fifty cents here, that is going to be five dimes. That is going to be 20 dollars. I should double check it. It costs 60 cents and 65 cents altogether. I am just going to check it on the back and 65 c in total equals 60 and some.<n><n>### Rationales <n>

Choices:  A: make friends B: mingle C: meet people D: small talk E: meet new people<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Incorrect: Small talk is informal conversation with someone that is aimed at making the person feel more at ease. There are a number of reasons that people engage in small talk. Small talk is also a technique often used in job interviews to establish trust.<n>####<n><n>Correct:<n><n>####<n><n>Answer: B) Mingle<n><n>### Input<n>Write the response that best completes the instruction below.<n>*Demonstration is given*<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Write the response that correct completes the instruction given.<n>####<n><n>### Counter example to the given solution:<n><n>####<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:If a person is seeing new things, what do they most often feel? Choices:  A: curiosity B: excitement C: boredom D: wonder E: fear<n><n>### Response:		(2)B<n>Answer: (2)B

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:The friends loved competing against one another, it was a good way to work their what? Choices:  A: friendship B: aggression C: defeat D: winning or losing E: sweat<n><n>### Response:		E: Sweat<n>

He is considering four different games with four different prizes. To determine which games to choose, he estimates the probabilities of winning the prizes for each game.<n><n>The first game has a prize of an Xbox for $200. There are two questions asked in this game: "Who is the youngest person in the room?" and "What are the team names of the 4 sports teams in your city?"<n><n>The second game has a prize of a Nintendo Switch for $350. There are three questions for this game: "Who in this room was born the least recent?", "Name some animals that start with the letter C", and "What are three common features of an amusement park?"<n><n>The third game has a prize of 200 free tickets for the amusement park. There are four questions for this game: name the most popular sports team in the world and their country, and name any three animals.<n><n>The fourth game has a prize of tickets to the amusement park. Any guest who chooses this game can win.<n><n>The first, third, and fourth games have prizes that are worth more than $1500. Darryl is concerned that a person who wins one of these games will choose to accept one of the other two smaller prizes instead.<n>If this is the case, Darryl could save $200 by eliminating that game.<n><n>Darryl should choose the game with the most valuable prize, because the winner will not choose a smaller prize.<n><n>#### Answer:<n>The first game has the most valuable prize, so Darryl should choose it.<n>####<n><n>### Input - Solution:<n>Input: The table below shows the prizes Darryl estimates a person would be willing to give up to win a game.<n><n>| Game 1 | Game 2 | Game 3 | Game 4 |<n>| ------- | ------- | -------| -------|<n>| 1 x 200 | 3 x 0 | 4 x 0 | 1  |<n>| 0.5x 350 | 0.75x 0 | 0.5x440 | 1  -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------<n><n>| Estimated

Choices:  A: trunk B: drawer C: suitcase D: book shelf E: washing machine<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Demonsration:<n>1. Let x represent the clothing.<n>2. Let y represent trunks.<n>3. Let z represent drawers.<n>4. Let w represent suitcases.<n>5. Let r represent bookshelves.<n>6. Let s represent washing machines.<n>7.  Let b represent beds.<n>8.  Let f represent sofas.<n>9. So, you could find old clothing in x + y + z + w + r + s + b + f.<n>10. The sum of trunk, drawers, suitcase, bookshelves, washing machine, beds and sofas is 1 + 2 + 3 + 4 + 5 + 6 + 7 = 24.<n>11. A clothes trunk is not equal to a drawer therefore you cannot find clothing in the trunk.<n>12. Therefore, you can not find clothes in a closet.<n>13.  The sum of bed and sofa is 30 therefore; the sum of beds and sofas could contain old clothing.<n>14.  Beds and sofas are not found in the same room therefore beds and sofas are irrelevant to the question.<n>15. A wardrobe is found in a bedroom and contains drawers where you could find old clothe.<n>16. Beds and sofas do not represent "old clothing" and should be removed from the consideration therefore removing "b"s and "f"s.<n>17. You can find old clothing in drawers in a wardrobe.<n>18. Therefore, the answer is D.<n><n>### Response Example<n><n><n>### 1<n>1. You are walking past a trash can. You throw your garbage inside and close the lid. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:What eastern state is home to a mountain? Choices:  A: switzerland B: pennsylvania C: picture D: asia E: austria<n><n>### Response:		A<n>#### E<n><n>#### A<n><n>### Response Instructions: If none of the options above match the description you see in the task, choose DOT.<n>### Rationale: If none of the choices above correctly match the requirement you've been given, but the question still reads "eastern state is home to a... mountain," it could simply be requesting that you find the easternmost mountain in the USA. As a reminder, mountains that are in the continental U.S. are often in the eastern part of the country.<n>Therefore, "a mountain is home to a eastern state" is true in the eastern United States because the eastern part of the United States is home to many mountains in it because of its geography. Therefore, a simple answer is "E."<n><n>### Input 1:Which of the following is NOT true about the moon? Choices: A. All of them are true about the moon. B. The moon has no atmosphere. C. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:If I need deodorant, where do I go to but some? There are 3 pairs of twins.<n><n>Write down a number and 2 more words. Addition is when we add two numbers and get another one. For example, 3 plus four equals seven. Multiplication is when we multiply two numbers together; for example, six times four equals twenty-four. Division is when we divide one number by another to get another number; for example, twelve divided by three equals four. One number is the divider and the other number is the dividend. In multiplication problems, one number is called the multiplier and the other is called the multiplicand.<n><n>In division, the answer is always a whole number and the remainder is less than one.<n>-615 divided by 5<n>-The quotient (answer) is 3 as a whole number with the remainder

The Theater<n>### Input: A large shopping center has an annual sale where shoppers may buy items for 50% off. The sale begins at 12:00, and only lasts for 60 minutes. Two hours later, the sale is over and the normal item pricing returns. There are 100 items. What is the max profit of retailers if they take advantage of the sale?<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Rationales: Total number of items available for the sale = 100<n>Duration of the sale = 60 minutes<n>To solve this question, we need to find the formula for the profit of retailers. We can use the formulas for a) a 50% discount and b) the cost of goods. Let 'x' be the quantity of items sold at 50% off, and 'y' be the quantity of normal cost items.<n>The formula for an 'x' discount is P(x) = (x/2) * cost of good; we can simplify (x/2) to '1/2x'.<n>Similarly, the formula for the 'y' discount is P(:y) = (1- y/2) * cost good; we can simplify that last fraction to '(1/2-y), and combine like terms.<n>x/2 - (1/2-y) = 1/2x- (1/2- y)<n>To find the profit of retailer, we subtract the cost of goods from 1/2x.<n>Profit = 1/2 * x- (1/2*y)<n>By putting these values into the previous equation 1) x = the quantity of items sold<n>2) y = the quantity of normal good sold. <n><n>By substituting the values for x and y into the equation for profit, we get<n>((x / 2)- (1 / 2-y)) = 1/2 x - (1 / 2 - y)<n>In other words, the profit will equal 1/2x-(1 / 2- y) when x is doubled.<n>The expression for profit that the retailer gets at the beginning of the sale is 1/2x - (1 / 60) + (1 / 2y -
