Choices:  A: conference B: theater C: building D: floor E: church<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### A: conference<n>#### B: theater<n>#### C: building<n>#### D: floor<n>#### E: church<n><n>#### A: conference Building A: conferance<n>#### B: thetaer Building B: theater<n><n>#### C: building Building C: building<n>#### E: church Church E: church<n><n>Input: The average life-span of a large pine tree is 500 years. Which of the following is not a prime number?<n>Rationales<n>The largest prime number is 23 # (one plus itself 23 times)<n>Four times one plus itself 9 times is 38^9 (twenty-nine plus itself nine times).<n>7* (seven plus itself nine times) = 239 (twenty-three times nine)<n>The last prime number before 239 has twice the digits.<n>239-1=238<n>16 is not a prime number.<n>#### 16<n>Answer: 16<n><n>Input: In the year 2019, there were 365 days in January 182 days in July. How many days in 2019?<n>Rationales 182 + 365 = 547<n>547 / 12 = 45 days for each month.<n>182 + 720 = 802<n>802 / 365 days January 2.19 days in January.<n>2.19 + 182.94 = 195.13<n><n>#### 195.00093056<n>Answer: 0.0009056<n><n>Input: Fred and Barney were walking to work, and Fred noticed that Barney was moving much faster then he was. He said, "Barney, why are you walking faster than me?" Barney answered, "Because I'm walking 8 inches each time, while you're walking only 6." How many inches does Barney walk each time?<n>Rationales Barney walks 8 inches each time.<n>2 * 8 = 16, the number of inches<n>Barney walks the same amount of times as Fred<n>Barney + 6 = the number of inches that Barney walks
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:The keys were black and white, what were they attached to? Choices:  A: front pocket B: cabinet C: purse D: chain E: piano<n><n>### Response:		<n>1.	Because it would be unlikely that a person would carry a purse and a piano at the same time.<n><n>### Response :<n>We are finding for the answer key to be "C" because we're going to answer the following :<n><n>### Criteria :<n><n>### Key Finding :<n>It's a hard question at first but in the end it is relatively easy to answer.<n><n><n>### Feedback: (Please rate 1-5 and provide comments.)<n><n>#### [Optional] If you wish to leave feedback on this submission or are a teacher and wish to comment on the feedback please add a comment in the following box or respond with an email to [TeacherMail@edvinelearning.com](mailto:TeacherMail@studyzone.com)

Which of the following pairs shows the greatest difference?<n><n>Directions: Answer the question in each of the five blanks.<n><n>A) 25<n><n>B) 7<n><n>C) 9<n><n>D) 63<n><n>E) 68<n><n>In the following pairs, one member is added to both members. Which of these pairs shows the smallest change?<n>A) 71<n><n>B) 8<n><n>C) 18<n><n>D) 3<n><n>E) -9<n><n>A) 83<n><n>B) 51<n><n>C) -65<n><n>D) -10<n><n>E) -77<n><n>The product of the members of each pair is shown. Which of these pairs has a greatest difference?<n>A) 801<n><n>B) -132<n><n>C) -30<n><n>D) -31<n><n>E) 39<n><n>A) -200<n><n>B) -87<n><n>C) -13<n><n>D) 28<n><n>E) 15<n><n>You and your 4 best friends start an ice cream delivery business. You decide to name it Chocolate.<n><n>Which of the following combinations of names can you use in these five spaces?<n>Ruth: A. B.<n>Amira: C. D.<n>Olga: E. F.<n>Ava: G. H.<n>Aleena: I. J.<n><n>### Explanation<n><n>- If the initial number is even, you subtract the number from the same location to the left and divide by two. The last digit will remain, the first digit will be doubled and the remainder will be added to an already given number to make it divisible by 8.<n>- For example, we started with 58. To make it divisible by eight, the last digit was (5 ÷ 2) = 2. Then, the 1 was doubled to become 2, with 3 remaining. To make up the last two digits, the 3 from the last location was combined with a pre-existing 
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:The artist didn't use many colors to capture the view, he was famous for his very plain what? He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:Wanting to avoid the cabbage spoiling, where did he put it? Choices:  A: grocery store B: refrigerator C: freezer D: plate E: supermarket<n><n>### Response:		Answer the following multiple choice question with a number, a mathematical symbol, or a phrase (i.e. 8 / 2, 3 x 4, 2x2), but no roman numerals.<n><n>### Rationale: To get all the numbers even in order, we would get the prime numbers first. We would start with prime numbers 2 and 3. 2x3 is 6. 5 is divided by 3. We get 5 / 3 which is not even so we get the next prime number 5.<n>5x5 is 25. We go to 7 which is divided by 3 and then 7x7 is 49. We get to 11 which is not divided by 3 so that is not even and we go to 11x11 or 121. We go for 13 and it is divided by 3 so 13x13 is 169.<n>Now for 19 is not even so we go to 19x19 which is 371. Next for 23 is divided by 3 = 72. Then for 29 which is not divided by three it goes to 29x29 or 859. Now we go to 31 is not divided by 4 and the last option to choose is 31x31 or 971.<n>We get 572 which is an even number. Since 572 is the last option that we have we have to choose that option. It is not 4 that is even but 5. We have chosen option D.

He calls his father, who lives in the city right down the road from him, and they talk in person for 58 minutes. Then he calls is brother, who lives in a separate town from him, and they call each other from cell phones to talk for 91 minutes. Since Freddy cares about his family, he wants to use a cheaper way to call his brother. Instead of charging 5 dollars for each 0.7 miles for long distance, Freddy will call his brother from the city and tell him to come pick him up at the airport. Since the city is only 38.6 miles away from the airport, Freddy figures the city would cost less than the town by 18.8 miles, which equals 18.8 x 0.7 = <<18.8 x.7=13>>13 cents. Freddy knows that airport tolls cost 5 cents per mile, so he will save 18.8 cents by calling his brother while in the city. Should Freddy save this money? He is still poor, but he likes to save money any chance he can.<n><n>### Input answer: The answer to the above problem is yes, Freddy should save the 18.8 cent amount to pay for the airport toll. Freddy's brother lives in the town, but would cost more for phone expenses<n><n>### Input # 2:<n>Amy and Dylan are going to the same middle school. Choices:  A: sit down B: make mistakes C: have sex D: reproduce E: excrete<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>#### Explanation<n>According to the question, people may use a restroom when their legs are tired. I picked this because humans generally do not reproduce when their legs are tired because they would not excrete but we already chose that already.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:Where is disease often spread but shouldn't be? Choices:  A: ghost town B: third world country C: human body D: rug E: hospital<n><n>### Response:		The choices are from the most to the least common. <n><n>### Demostration: <n><n>**Choices:**<n>A: ghost town<n>B: third world country<n>C: human body<n>D: rug<n><n><n>### Conclusion - Answer the question below:<n>How do you get disease?<n>Choices:<n>A) breathing contaminated air<n>B) drinking contaminated water<n>C) shake hands<n>D) all of the above<n><n>### Instructions:<n>1) The bacteria and viruses spread when <n><n>2) Bacteria and viruses most often spread through <n><n>3)<n><n>4) If we all washed our hands more regularly we might not get disease<n>5) The easiest way to get disease is by drinking contaminated<n>

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:Where is a snake likely to reside? Choices:  A: tropics B: nightmare C: wyoming D: bushes E: feild<n><n>### Response:		F<n><n>### Input<n><n>####  I: Answers the following multiple choice question<n>#### II: Demonstrations<n>Input: Cynthia has 80 percent of the apples in a warehouse. Samantha bought an apple from the warehouse. That means she owns 12 percent of the apples. How many more apples does Cynthia have than Samantha?<n>Rationales:"Cynthia has 100% - Samantha's apple" and "Samantha's apple + 100% = Cynthia has"<n>In words:<n>"Cynthia has (80% - Samanthas apple)%" and "(Samanthas apple + 10% = Cynthis has)(Apple is a product of one percent) = Cynthias apple"<n>Combining like,<n>we get (Cynthias apple - 10) / 90 =  Samanthas apple<n>"Samanthas apple = Cynthias apps"<n>(Cynthias apple + 10) = Samanthas apple<n>50 + 10 = 60<n><n>Input: You live in an apartment that cost 900 dollars per month excluding tax. Last month, you had your water bill that cost 150 dollars. So your total expenses came to 900+150=1050 dollars. How much more does your water bill cost you than living accommodations, if anything?<n>Rationales 1: "This is the amount, this is the 2nd amount"<n>2: If x=150 and 10x=1500<n>then, x=75<n>3: 1: you have 150 2: you need 750<n>4: (1500 - 150)/150 = 750/75"$516.00"<n>5: 1500-150=$1580.00 - $135.00 = $1445.00<n>6:<n><n>### Answer: You pay $1445 dollars more in water last month than you pay monthly for your apartment."$

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:Where would you hear a viola along side many other string and brass instruments? Choices:  A: symphony B: band C: create music D: orchestra E: string quartet<n><n>### Response:		The answer is D: orchestra. According to my research, A, B, D, E are valid options. The viola can be grouped into different types of orchestras, namely symphony orchestras, brass and string orchestras. Brass and string orchestrs (B, D) have other brass instruments such as trumpets and trombones instead of string instruments(violas). String quartets are made up of two violins, viola, and cello.<n>The viola can only be part of orchestras which makes (C) not be a viable choice. My opinion, the answer is (D).<n><n>### Answer: The viola is a stringed instrument that can be played in any orchestra. It is the middle-sized between the mandolin and the cello. It is made from maple and rosewood. It is played in an orchestra where it is referred to as the alto viola. The violin was created in the Byzantine Empire in around 500 C.E. while the viola was created later in 1550 in Italy.<n>#### 5030<n>Answer: The viola is one of the four major string musical instruments, and it is a bowed and string instrument. In classical music, the name viola is often used to refer to the violin. But, it also appears in small orchestras where it is referred to one of two varieties: (1) alto viola- it is a smaller cousin of the violin, (2) and is often a second-best instrument. The viola is between the cello and the violin in size and tone. The viola is part of the double bass family of string instruments. The instruments are usually made out of the wood that is made of maple and rosewood and are painted a dark brown with black fittings. <n><n>The viola is believed to have been created in Italy in the 1550s. The viola is made up of a big, round back made of maple and the back is hollow on one side. The viola player then fits a piece of bone or ivory on the inside of the back, to give the back shape. The bow is made of horsehair and it fits the instrument perfectly. This instrument is made to play melodies alone or in harmony with other instruments

Then you divide 580 into 60 minutes which makes the minutes 9.9.

He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:James kept a clipboard where he could easily find  it.  Where might he keep it? Choices:  A: shelf B: place of work C: desk D: office supply store E: school<n><n>### Response:		<n>A. In the place of worship.<n><n>#### 2<n>Answer: A<n><n>### Input 2:<n>James has a clipboard to store all of his notes. From what building or location can he easily retrieve it? Choices: A: office B: room C: desk D place of work E: school<n><n>#### 22<n>Answer: E<n><n>### Input<n>The following are integers. Use the symbols >, <, or = to show which is greater than or equal to the other.<n>4.9, 3.57, 5.24<n><n>#### 9<n>Answer: 4.9 >= 3.57<n><n>### Input (More than one response allowed) <n>Ruby wants to make her own playlist. She’s thinking of music videos from 808s & Heartbreak, My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy, and Yeezus. What would her playlist be called?<n><n>### Multiple Choice<n>Choose the correct answer for each statement.<n><n>#### 6<n>Answer: A<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:Why shouldn't you walk barefooted after the rain? Choices:  A: shoes B: wet ground C: wet clothes D: start to fall E: water garden<n><n>### Response:		We can find the most obvious solution to get the maximum score.<n>### Answer:<n>You should answer as much as possible to avoid the maximum score, so you can get high test scores.<n>### Why:<n>Because a question is related to the story, answers do not need to be true. (For example: Why can't you see a tree with the help of a telescope?) <n>Sometimes the answer is in the story, and other times you'll find the answer in another story.<n>If you need to write something about the story, then you can start your answer.<n>This will help you increase the test score. <n><n>### Answer:

Choices:  A: house B: den C: family room D: wood E: floor<n><n>### Response:		<n>Let x = the seat.<n>(A) x = house and 12 * the x = <<2*12=24>>24 feet.<n>(B) The x = den. 6*the x = <<6*12=5>>(5.18) feet.<n>(C) The x = family room. 3*the x = <<3*12=36>>36 feet.<n>(D) The x = wood. 9*the x = <<9*12=108>>108 feet.<n>(E) The x = floor. 4*the x = <<4*12=48>>48 feet.<n>The total combined height (in feet) = 24 + 5.18 + 36 + 48 + 108 = <<24+5.18+36+48+108=223>>223 feet<n><n>### Answer:<n>The answer to this question is (A).<n><n><br><n>### Extra credit:Write two multi-digit numbers together and add them.<n><n>#### Answer:<n>The answer is 22<n><n>### Extra Credit: Multiply: <n><n>#### Answer: <n><n>The answer to this example is 16<n> <n>### Extra extra credit : Write two multi-digit numbers using addition and subtraction to get the product.<n><n>#### Answer<n><n>The answer to the following question is 256<n><n>532<n>532 <n><n>## Explanation:<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>### Demostrate:<n>Here's a task to demonstrate understanding of the instruction.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:The museum made an odd choice for the koala display, they put the stuffed creature in what area where you'd usually find a panda? Choices:  A: north carolina B: washington state C: nil D: great outdoors E: garden of eden<n><n>### Response:		<n>I agree that apple tree located in washington state because A: The fruit was forbidden to Adam and Eve.<n>B: apple tree located in North Carolina was forbidden because the forbidden fruit was an apple.<n>C: I disagree that apple tree located in Great outdoors because it is a different state from the previous ones.<n>D: apple tree located in Garden of Eden because it also in the forbidden state or location. E: apple tree located in nil cause it is a fruit and it is not the forbidden one. <n><n>### Dumpster Diving<n><n>#### Instruction:<n>Input: One hot summer, a city council declared a few dumpsters owned by city residents to be the property of the city. As a result, the city increased their recycling rates by 0.8%. As they do not wish to impose taxes, they instead collected a small percentage of the savings of each resident's property. The following table shows how much each dumpster owner saved as a percent of their property's value.<n>Table 1. Dumpster Savings<n>Property Value in Thousands of Dollars<n>675<n>6,750<n>5,730<n>5,760<n>3,630<n>7,040<n>128<n>1,928<n>810<n>1900<n>800<n>3100<n>10,270<n>5775<n>0<n>8500<n>3340<n>9000<n>3509<n>5100<n>5,435<n>6225<n>> 7084<n>5,503, 694, 5,432, 5,354,5,676<n>2,977<n>2,505<n>6,000,17,732<n>600<n>What was the net value of savings to the city?<n><n><n>#### Rationales:<n><n>First, we plug the values into the formula, saving = x % * property value Then, solving the equation for x, we have x = 0.8 % * (property value - 1) <n><n>Since we know that 0.8% of 5760 is 4

He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:What are adult people usually expected to do? Choices:  A: shake hands B: own property C: pay bills D: smoke E: talk to each other<n><n>### Response:		<n>B<n><n>In order for someone to own property, the person must be a legal adult of at least age 18. By the time a person reaches the age of 18 in the United States, the person must be able to:<n><n>- Shake hands (an adult person will have reached the required age to gain adult status, and will also be able to shake hands with other adult people)<n>- Pay bills (it is common to pay bills in the form of currency, so the person will not be able to pay bills if the person does not have currency. A person who is legally considered an adult person will be able to pay bils, therefore will have currency)<n>- Talk to each other (there is very little that would prohibit an adult person from talking to another adult person. There is also very litle that would prevent an adult person from talking with another adult person. For these reasons adult people are expected to talk to each other)<n><n>#### None of these.<n>Answer: B<n><n>### Instructions:Answer each of the following questions without using a calculator. (This is a math questions)<n><n>### Demostration:<n>#### 95 * 3<n><n>Answer: <<>><n><n>### Input :A school has a science lab next to the restrooms. The science lab is 90 feet to the east of the restrooms and 57 feet west of the library. It takes the student council president 2 minutes to walk from the restrooms to the science lab. It takes the science teacher 2 minutes to reach the library from the laboratory. The student council president is 60 feet away from the lab when she is standing at the library. How many minutes from the restrooms must he walk to reach the science lab?<n><n>### Response : He must walk 4 times the distance from the restrooms to to the science lab. So he would have to walk 4*90 = 360 feet, therefore, 360/5 = 72 seconds.<n><n>### None of these.<n><n>Answer: 360 minutes<n><n>#### 4<n><n>### Input;What do the answers below represent? Choices:A: 1/25 B: 0.04 C: 13 D: 0.25 E: 3/4<n><n>##
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:Dan said that getting in line was the best choice because it would lead to what? Choices:  A: being ordered B: less confusion C: boredom D: standing in line E: have to wait for<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Input :While preparing for the SAT test I decided to concentrate on what areas? Choices:  Math  ACT Reading  B: Reading comprehension C: English Language  D: Math  E: Literature<n><n>### Response :C<n><n><n>

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Tapanga and Corey have 66 candies together. However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:When playing baseball they keep track of mistakes, this stat is called what? Choices:  A: happiness B: sore muscles C: injury D: perfection E: errors<n><n>### Response:		B.<n><n>### Explanation:<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following:<n><n>### Input The following:<n><n>Gabriela and Luna have a sum of money. Gabriela had twice as many dollars as Luna. If Luna earned $40 by selling her things, Gabriela earned 15% of her total money. Luna earned $212 by selling her things. Let x represent her first sale value, let y represent her second sale value, and let z represent her total income.<n>x + y + z = the total sales amount Luna made.<n>x + y = Gabriela's sales amount.<n>z + z + 15*x/100 = Gabriela' s sales amount after she made the sale.<n>Solving that equation gives us Gabriela's total sales.<n>Dividing (x + y + z)/x = Gabriela' percentage of each sale.<n><n><n>### Instructon:Answer the following multiple Choice question:<n><n>### Explantion:<n>I got a perfect score on my test<n>Let x equal the total number of marks Gabriela got on her test. Then, to find the value of, the number of marks Gabriella got on her test, we need to find x% of x.<n>Dividing x by x will give us the value of x and it multiplying the value of x to 1 will give us.1(G) = <<1*0.1=0.1>>.01 (E).<n><n>.01 (E) >.1 (G)<n>Thus x > (0.1<n>Thus by solving for x, we get x =.09.<n><n>### x =.09<n><n>### Answer: The value I got off a multiple choice is 2/8 = �%<n><n>### I got a 1% error on my answer

He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. Choices:  A: builders B: driver C: architect D: fall down E: tradesmen<n><n>### Response:		You build the architect's designs<n><n>### Input<n>### Output : 1 = A<n>1 = B<n>1 = C<n>1 = D<n>1 = E<n><n>### Instructions<n><n>Answer the following multiple choice questions.<n><n>### Input 1:The cost to build a bike trail is $6,500 and the cost to build a playground is $8,000. What portion of the budget is allocated to the play ground?<n><n>### Inputs: Tapanga has 2,050 fewer marbles than Freddy. When the two count their marbles together, they end up with a total of 994. How many marbles does Freddy have?<n><n>### Rationales: If x = the number of marbles Tapanga has, then x + (x − Freddy’s total) – Freddy’s total = 994<n>x + (x − <<994-2050=4>>4) − <<994=4>>4 = 994/4= <<994/4===>247>>247<n>4 * x − x = 4 * 4 -x = 4 * 3 = 12<n>Subtracting the 12 from both sides, we find that x = 247. So Freddy has 247 marbles.<n><n>### Answer: 247<n><n>#### 247<n>Answer: 247marbles<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>__Solution__ <n>___Step 1:_____<n>```<n>// Create the list with an integer as its elements<n>// Add the elements 1, 2, and 3 that are in that list to the list1<n><n>List1 = []<n>List1.append(1)<n>List1.append("2")<n>List1.append((3))<n><n># You can use a loop to count values in a list<n># You can do this by using for loop in Python<n>for item in List1:<n>    print(item)<n>```<n><n><n>___Step 2:_____<n>```  <n># Loop through the each numbers from List1<n><n>count = 1<n>while True:<n>    print("Number of element:",count)<n>

He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:A person who wants to make more at their job but can't will often need to find a what? Choices:  A: own house B: better job C: win lottery D: save money E: feel safe<n><n>### Response:		The person must choose to work hard, which could lead them to find a better job, win the lottery, or save money for their own house. They could also feel safe if things were going well for them.<n><n>### Input<n>A: 299 x 2<n><n>B: 25 x 2<n><n>C: 20 x 2<n><n>D: 4 x 2<n><n>E: 59<n><n>### Rationales<n>To make 299, choose two of each of the numbers. Do this 2 more times to get 259. Then you have all the numbers.<n>To make 259, choose 2,3,6,7, and 13. Choose those numbers 2 more times to make 2,3,4, and 8.<n>To make 4, choose two fours. Do it again for 8.<n><n>59 means 12,36,54,63,72,81 to do it!<n>#### 59<n>Answer: 59<n>

However, Tapanga has 8 more candies than Corey. How many candies does Corey have?<n>Rationales: Let x = the total number of candies Corey has.<n>x + 8 = the total number of candies Tapanga has.<n>The equation for the total number of candies is x + (x + 8) = 66<n>Combining like terms, we get 2x + 8 = 66<n>Subtracting 8 from both sides, we get 2x = 58<n>Dividing both sides by 2, we get x = <<29=29>>29, so Corey has 29 candies.<n>#### 29<n>Answer: 29<n><n>Input: Freddy is calling his family on New Year's Eve. He calls his dad, who lives in the same city as him, and they talk for 45 minutes. Then he calls his brother, who lives on the other side of the world, and they talk for 31 minutes. Local calls cost 5 cents a minute, while international calls cost 25 cents a minute. How many dollars did Freddy spend calling his family on New Year's Eve?<n>Rationales: At 5 cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy 5* 45 = <<5*45=225>>225 cents.<n>At 25 cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy 25 * 31 = <<25*31=775>>775 cents.<n>Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of 225 + 775 = <<225+775=1000>>1000 cents.<n>Since each dollar has 100 cents, Freddy paid 1000 / 100 = <<1000/100=10>>10 dollars<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:Where would you find fungus growing on something made from milk? Choices:  A: eyes B: biology laboratory C: shower stall D: old cheese E: decaying matter<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>Demonstration:Milk is a nutritious liquid produced by mammals like cows, goats, and humans (and used by them to nourish their young.) For humans, milk is an important source of carbohydrates, proteins, vitamins, and minerals.<n>Cows, goats and sheep are ruminants (mammals that digest food by fermenting plant matter in two or four stomachs), so ruminants produce milk. It is true that there is a biological difference that has been exploited in biological science for centuries, making it relatively easy to obtain milk. In general, humans have only two milk ducts that run from the nipple into the breast. Ruminants have much more milk ducts running into the different stomachs that can store milk. But in order to have more milk ducts you need some extra parts on the body, specifically bones, muscles and blood vessels.<n><n>But the reason why fungus would grow on something made from milk is because milk has a large number of complex sugars that are easily used by fungi. So yes there will be fungus growing on cheese especially which is made from milk or things that look like it.<n><n>####  D<n>Answer: D<n><n>### Input:: There are two different classes of fungi. These classes are called Basidiomycota and Ascomycota. They can be distinguished by the different modes of spore release. Basesiomycota produces basidiums that are club-shaped fungus pieces with fuzzy ends. Ascomycota produces ascus that are cigar-shaped fungus pices with a hole in the end.<n><n>### Response:--<n><n>    ## Question: Where would you find fungus?<n><n>    ## Demonstration: <n><n>    ## If fungi can be distinguished by the shape of their spores, <n><n>    ## then they could be found in places that have shapes that resemble their spores.<n><n>    ## For Ascomycota, fungi are cigar shaped and have a single hole in that shape.<n><n>    ## These are called ___________________<n><n>    ## In the class __________________ the spores are shaped as _____________. They are called ____________<n><n>    ##

Choices:  A: airplane B: construction site C: shops D: engine E: broken bone<n><n>### Response:		<n>The metal rod in most people preferred method of transportation would be an engine. Here is why. There is a metal rod in an airplane engine, there is a metal rod in a construction site, there is a metal wire in shops, no one keeps a metal rod on their person and the least used metal rod is in a broken bone.<n><n>### Rationales:<n>A airplane contains an engine with a metal rod.<n>B construction site contains a metal rod.<n>C Shop includes a lot of metal wire as it is used commonly to wrap a lot of objects.<n>D E engine is a metal rod but is broken, so that does not work.<n>No one is actually walking around with a metal rod on their body.<n>Since metal rod is the least used, is not very common to find a metal rod.<n><n>#### Engine<n>Answer: E<n><n>### Instructions:If you were an architect, would you rather make a building taller or more spacious?
